It's just so beautiful here. Did you grow up here?
And your mom?
I'm pretty sure my father lives in Colorado.
He drank. It was my mom that raised me. She was incredible.
She held it together for so long, I couldn't tell how sick she was.

They gave her very heavy meds for pain. Dilauded, morphine, oxycontin. I started taking them with her. We would get all medicated and sit in our back yard and talk and talk and watch the sun go down. We'd be so stoned that we couldn't get up to go inside when it got dark.
I know it sounds crazy to get hooked on dope with your mom, but she was dying and we spent her last seven months together like teenagers, trading stories about boys and whatever. She loved me.
Are you okay? How was it?
Well, I got through my first day.
They needed someone to work the night shift. They asked me and it's time and a half so...

It was my grandfather's farm, my dad grew up here. He was a pilot in World War II, flew with the 332nd. See the landing strip out there? He built that. He ran a crop duster outta here until the EPA put an end to that.
He traded the crop duster for a used Cessna. He flew that damn thing all over. It's still in the barn. I was gonna sell this place after my dad died. Then I got divorced...
